5 hrs x1 for a single final reflection paper

Overall, great course. However, some speakers were really below average. I think it would be better if all speakers were required to have a PowerPoint or handout, even if very short. Basically, some of them rambled.
Loved hearing from prominent leaders in healthcare. I do with we were in a different space -- the roundtable format isn't sustainable given the number of students who regularly attend Colloquium.

Strengths: Able to hear from a variety of high profile leaders in healthcare.

Weaknesses:  Lack of structure in the course.  Depending on the speaker, it can turn into an hour of "let me tell you about my career", with limited opportunity for student interaction.  Thursdays at 6:30pm is also not the most ideal time for the course given conflicts at SOM during this time as well as potential travel conflicts with recruiting.
excellent
access to senior leadership that i usually won't have in other settings

Strength - great speakers
weaknesses - no summarizing insights in a formalized way

Great course. Had invited insightful speakers that were great to learn from. I would like to see more diversity within the speakers who are invited. Would love to see more people of color or individuals with an international focus.
This was one of my favorite experiences at Yale thus far. Outstanding and interesting speakers - I learned so much about leadership and career trajectories.

Excellent course and idea.  
Some of the guests went off on tangents that had little value to me and I believe the rest of the students. It would have helped if someone could have helped steer the guests back to the point of the colloquium.
The guests should stay focused on what they do, their milestones in life, their set-backs, and how they got to where they are today.
very interesting, I really liked it
n/a
Excellent topics discussed by health care leaders
A great parade of guest speakers at the top of their field.
The diversity of speakers brought in this year was great! I really enjoyed listening to their stories and the opportunity to get to know a couple of them on a deeper level during the dinners.
great to hear insights from leading healthcare stakeholders
Great speakers invited, would have loved more structure to discussions and chance to submit questions in advance.
These seminar-style courses are what I expect out of a grad program. There were many times during colloquium that I felt inspired and motivated and extremely happy to be at this school.
Very great selection of speakers
Not necessarily applicable since Prof. Forman was really just the moderator. That being said, he did a great job of bringing in relevant speakers and fostering a positive learning envieonment.

Strengths: Brilliant mind, high energy, well-connected

Weaknesses:  Ideally the course could be made more about the students and less about the guest speakers, although I understand that these are esteemed guests we are hosting.
excellent

Great at asking insightful questions.
Thank you for bringing in such fabulous speakers.

Dr. Forman facilitated and got out of the way of the speakers. Better that way.
incredible human being who brings his connections to students
Extremely passionate about the course, students, and lecturers

Howie's great and has a great rapport with the speakers and tries to make everyone feel comfortable. A couple of times I did feel a bit of an "old boy's club" vibe with some of the speakers we had, however.
Great man.
Highly recommend -- great way to directly hear from and engage with movers and shakers across all sectors of healthcare.

I would recommend to another student, especially if the schedule could be changed to host this on another evening in the week.  Limited time commitment, but it is difficult for SOM students to make it to the med school on time for these talks.
It is really nice to have the opportunity to interact with all the speakers. It is a really good course
excellent, real-life exposure with the leaders and aspirations!
cool chance to hear from high-powered folks in the healthcare sector
Yes, i felt like i learned a lot from the speakers and always felt inspired after I left the room.
Outstanding! Incredible opportunity to hear from such inspiring and successful healthcare leaders.
